ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course teaches you a lot about product design, how to manage a team project, and how to design your own project. It also provides insight on how to work with clients.
Learned nothing new in this class from MENG 185 or 325. In fact frequently use the same slides which is pretty annoying because you need to sit through lectures
I learned how to mix concrete. I visited Long Island for the first time in my life. I think I also gained experience with the engineering design process.
Confidence as an engineer, ability to work with a team of various skillsets and skill levels, Knowledge of how to take on an industry level project.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Different projects require totally different engineering analyses but all students are held to same standard which is counterproductive because much of the time is spending filling out documents. Sometimes this is necessary and helpful for real engineering jobs, but not all paperwork is always necessary

I like that the class provides structured work time for our projects. I think the level of guidance/intervention vs. letting us go through the steps ourselves is about right. On the weak side, the lectures did not always correlate with what we were doing and Dr. Booth did not seem invested in giving them. Our design reviews weren't really graded until end of term.

It was very fun and motivating to work with a real engineering company. The professor was supportive when he needed to and hands off when he felt we had space for growth. There was the right amount of guidance where it didn't feel overbearing or micromanaging. The easy to digest but information heavy lectures were  a pleasure to sit through.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: You gotta take if senior engineer. I didn't like it. If you're not sure about doing engineering, abet is not worth it
Yes, It teaches you how to be a real engineer.
This class is difficult but rewarding and great for adding portfolio entries.
